title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 372.2 - Procedures

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 372.2 - Procedures

State Regulations
(a) Requests for
declaratory rulings shall be made to the chairman of the board upon a form
prescribed by the board which shall contain sufficient information to identify
with particularity the person, the property or the state of facts and the rule
or statute enforceable by the board, the applicability of which is sought to be
determined, or shall identify with particularity the action with respect to
which the declaratory ruling is sought. (b) Such request may be accompanied by a
memorandum in support setting forth the reasons for the request. Requests
pursuant to this subdivision shall be granted or denied by the chairman within
30 days of the date on which such request is received in proper form by the
chairman, provided that in the case of a request for a declaratory ruling with
respect to whether an action by the board should be taken pursuant to a rule, the request shall be granted or denied by the chairman within 60 days of such
date. (c) The rulings of the
chairman shall be final and maintained as public records by the board, available for inspection pursuant to Part 371 of this Title. (d) Requests for declaratory ruling
